thread.title: Arsenal v Sutton: Sub keeper eats pie during FA Cup match | Daily Star
thread.title_full: Arsenal v Sutton: Sub keeper eats pie during FA Cup match | Daily Star

author: Andrew Mcdonald
title: Arsenal v Sutton: Sub keeper eats pie during FA Cup match | Daily Star
text:
Sutton Utd goalkeeper gains legendary status after eating PIE during Arsenal game Sutton Utd goalkeeper gains legendary status after eating PIE during Arsenal game FOOTBALL fans went wild when they noticed Sutton's reserve goalkeeper filling his face during their FA Cup clash against Arsenal. / Published 21st February 2017 
Arsenal beat non-league Sutton 2-0 on an artificial pitch in Gander Green Lane with goals by Lucas Perez and Theo Walcott. 
But while the Gunners went through to the quarter-finals it was Wayne Shaw who stole the hearts of a nation with his legendary antics. 
After the Yellows made all three of their substitutions, the 20-stone reserve keeper was caught tucking into a gigantic pie for all to see. 
TWITTER NOM NOM NOM: Sutton's sub goalkeeper scoffs a pie during the FA Cup clash against Arsenal 
In slow motion footage – available above – the hefty 46-year-old sub takes a huge bite out of the pie before wiping his mouth clean. 
A bemused BBC commentator says: "He's getting stuck into a pie safe in the knowledge that he won't be coming on. 
"What would Arsene Wenger say?!" 
The clip was quickly shared on social media with footie fans praising Wayne for keeping it real. 
One Twitter fan wrote: "Legend!" 
Another commented: "Amazing!" 
And a third added: "He was hoovering the dug out before the game too! An unsung hero!” 
TWITTER DELICIOUS: Sutton's sub keeper Wayne Shaw wipes his mouth at the Arsenal match Twitter reacts to Arsenal's win over Sutton in the FA Cup Monday, 20th February 2017 ARSENAL beat Sutton in the FA Cup today - but Gunners fans are less than happy. 1 / 14 
He was also spotted hanging out with the Sutton fans in the bar during half-time, despite still facing the possibility of coming on. 
Wayne admitted before the match: "During my career I have not played a great deal but I have been there when needed." 
Arsenal will now play Lincoln City in the quarter finals of the FA Cup at the Emirates on March 11. 
Theo Walcott scored his 100th Arsenal goal during the match. Related articles
